description.dataset: Name of the dataset. The title needs to be short and easily recognizable and searchable. If there is an acronym, please also provide the long name.
description.experiment: Name of the experiment. The title needs to be short and easily recognizable and searchable. If there is an acronym, please also provide the long name.

The person(s) or organization(s) that contributed to the creation of the experiment. This can be the principal investigator, hospital, university, centre  , clinic, etc. The first contact provided will be associated as the main contact for this experiment.

A short paragraph providing a rapid overview of the experiment and the context of data collection. Suggestion of items to include in the description (if applicable): main use of the experiment, population studied, study design, sample size, data collected, methods, techniques, apparatus used to generate the data. Ideally, the first sentence of the description should give a good overall description of the experiment.
Terms to describe the nature of the data. Data type can be single or multiple. Add a term with the interlex URI if possible.

Provide the version number, or the release point of your experiment. If you do not have an existing versioning convention, we recommend the use of the following versoning convention: 1.0=original experiment; 1.1=minor revisions made to the experiment; 1.2=further minor revisions; 2.0=major/substantive changes to the experiment. For example: minor changes could include corrupted file or link fixes, more description/documentation of the experiment and so on; Major changes would include additional data released (more subjects, more modalities and so on)

A qualifier to describe the data protection applied to the experiment. This is relevant for clinical data.
  • open: freely and publicly available
  • registered: available to bona fide researchers/clinical care professionals only
  • controlled: available to qualified researchers approved by a committee after review of their research proposal; also known as managed or restricted access
  • private: available only to researchers of the project; also known as closed
The licences under which this experiment is shared.
Tags associated with the experiment, which will help in its discovery. These should be well known terms by the research community.
The technical format of the ${selfString} distribution. Use the file extension or MIME type when possible. (Definition adapted from DataCite).
The quantity of space required on disk (or other medium) for this ${selfString}.
Unit in which the size is measured.(KB -> KiloByte, MB -> MegaByte, GB -> GigaByte, TB -> TeraByte and PB -> PetaByte).
The information about access modality for the ${selfString} distribution.

A URL (Web page) that contains information about the associated ${selfString} (with a link to the ${selfString}) or a direct link to the ${selfString} itself. When none exists yet, please provide the link to the README.md file of the ${selfString}.

This must be one of "Public", "Registered" or "Private". When this field is absent the value will be treated as "Public". "Public" = available to anyone; "Registered" = available to user authorized by the creator; "Private" = available only to the creator.
Total number of files in the ${selfString}.
Total number of subjects constituting the ${selfString}.

The CONP status is used to add the CONP logo or Canadian flag on the left of the ${selfString} and sorting in the data search. Valid values are "CONP" = created using funding from the CONP; "Canadian" = created in Canada without CONP funding; "external" = created outside of Canada.

Name of the institution or consortium that generated the ${selfString}. Both an institution and a consortium can be specified, e.g. in the case of a named collaboration between different la  bs at the same institution.
Name of the institution where this ${selfString} was created (if applicable).
Name of the consortium where this ${selfString} was created (if applicable).
(Principal) city where this ${selfString} was created.
(Principal) province where this ${selfString} was created.
(Principal) country where this ${selfString} was created.
Required for derived ${selfString}s only. Provide information about the source ${selfString} this ${selfString} has been derived from.
Name of the source ${selfString} used to generate this ${selfString}.
Identifier (DOI) of the source ${selfString} used to generate this ${selfString}.
The primary publication(s) associated with the ${selfString}, usually describing how the ${selfString} was produced.

primaryPublications.publicationVenue.name: Publication Venue

primaryPublications.dates.name: Dates
primaryPublications.dates.description: Relevant dates for the publication. If you provide a date, it must come with a description of the date (i.e.: first submission, final approval, date of publication, ...).

primaryPublications.identifier.name: Identifier
primaryPublications.identifier.description: A code uniquely identifying the publication locally to a system or globally. Provide a Document Object Identifier (DOI) if you have one.

primaryPublications.identifier.identifie.name: Identifier Source
primaryPublications.identifier.identifie.description: Information about the organisation/namespace responsible for minting the identifier. It must be provided if the identifier is provided.

description.experiment: The different dimensions (granular components) making up a ${selfString}. Providing dimensions give more details about the data types.
A code uniquely identifying the ${selfString} locally to a system or globally.

identifier.identifierSource.name: Source
identifier.identifierSource.description: Information about the organisation/namespace responsible for minting the identifier. It must be provided if the identifier is provided.

logo.name: Logo
logo.description: Link to a URL for the logo or local filename containing the logo.

description.experiment: Relevant dates for the ${selfString}. If you provide a date, it must come with a description of the date (i.e.: first data collection, last data collection, date of first publication, ...).
Provide contact information (name and email address) of the person responsible for the ${selfString}.

description.dataset: Process which generated a given dataset.

description.experiment: Entities (biological entity, taxonomic information, disease, molecular entity, anatomical part, treatment) associated with this ${selfString}. You must provide a species, and other entities are optional.
Grant(s) which funded and supported the work reported by the ${selfString}.
The geographical extension and span (i.e.: city, province, administrative region, ...) covered by the ${selfString}.
